parameters: You bump your foot against something as you trudge through the slime, and curse as you feel it roll away. Luckily, whatever it is, it’s red, so you are able to find it with a bit of searching. You come out with a sparkling little ruby, an excellent find. You should be able to sell it for a pretty good price somewhere in town.

You bump your foot against something hard, and reach down to find a worn sword submerged in the slime. Your lucky you didn’t accidentally cut yourself on it, who would be irresponsible enough to just leave a sword in here? Well, whatever, it’s your gain now. Not that you can actually use it, but it should still be worth a few coins if you sell it in town. You get the feeling Beatrice would probably buy it off of you, even though she doesn't sell swords.

Your foot comes down atop of something small and circular, shaped like a coin. Reaching down, you discover that it is, in fact, a silver coin. After a bit of scrounging about, you find five coins all in all. Nice.

Your foot comes down atop of something small and circular, shaped like a coin. Reaching down, you discover that it is, in fact, a silver coin. After a bit of scrounging about, you find four coins all in all. Nice.

Your foot comes down atop of something small and circular, shaped like a coin. Reaching down, you discover that it is, in fact, a silver coin. After a bit of scrounging about, you find three coins all in all.

Your foot bumps against something hard, and you reach down, eager for yet more loot. Unfortunately, old, ruined boots don’t count as loot. This one didn’t even have the decency to have coins inside of it! You suppose you could have just gotten unlucky, but you suspect you might’ve just drained this well dry, what with all you’ve already found.
A small patch of blue flowers lies here, matches the description of Elmsbloom perfectly, so you should pluck some for Beatrice’s quest. You’ll need fifteen bunches of this size all together.
That makes fifteen, so you should have plenty to fulfill Beatrice’s request. You’ve got the dickweed as well, so now you just need to deliver these materials to Beatrice.
That makes fifteen, so you should have plenty to fulfill Beatrice’s request. Now all you need to do is find that philiticus-increm.
You've already gathered Elmsbloom from here, you'll probably piss off the Elves if you don't leave some behind to regrow.
You’ve collected the required amount of Elmsbloom already, and you don’t see anyone but Beatrice buying the stuff from you, so there’s no need to get more.

You open up a wardrobe, and find it filled to the brim with a number of dresses. And when you say a number of dresses, you mean a number of copies of the exact same dress, the same as the one she was wearing in the throne room where you bested her. It’s mostly black, but with golden trim throughout it. It also has the symbol of the Brainwashing Bondage Bimbo’s, reminding you of their truly horrible name. Do they not even realize it makes it sound like the members of the cult are the Bimbo’s? Well, whatever, you certainly aren’t wearing any of these. Let’s try the next one.

\..\..\..Okay, that’s the third wardrobe filled exclusively with the \fiexact same dresses.\fi How many wardrobes are in here, one, two, three\..\..\.. twelve? There’s no fucking way she’s filled \fbtwelve\fb wardrobes with the same dress, right? What would even be the point? The maids clean them every day, she would need like, three, tops.

\..\..\..Okay, you don’t have the mental fortitude to keep checking these. You’d rather just steal one of these dresses and live in a world where you can pretend Alexandra doesn’t own twelve wardrobes filled with one dress, than go check the rest of these and learn what you already know. The cabinet by the bed at least has underwear—though they are all the same golden color and style—so you take those as well and put them on. Might as well complete the outfit.
You fall into another pitfall, but an empty hole isn't much of a threat with no one around to chase you.
Shit! A pitfall! You quickly manage to scramble out, but you need to run!
Shit! Another pitfall! You quickly try to scramble out, and actually succeed! These are just empty holes, but you need to run!

ShockShield is the effect that you gain when casting Ice and Lightning in a combo. It provides damage reduction just like the FrostShield spell, but also reflects some damage back to melee attackers. This upgrade increases the duration of the ShockShield skill by 1, and increases the damage reflected to melee attackers by 5%. Each level of this skill costs 2 skill points, and provides 1 point of progress in the skill tree for both of it's elements. The max level of this skill is 2.

Each level of this skill costs 2 skill points, and provides 1 point of progress in the skill tree for both of it's elements. The max level of this skill is 2.

Frost Shield activates when you cast Ice without it being part of a combo, reducing the damage you take for a certain amount of turns. This upgrades increases the damage reduction of frost shield by 5% per level. The max level of this skill is 3.

Frostburn is the debuff you inflict on enemies when you cast Ice and Fire in a combo. The effect reduces the opponents defense and deals damage each turn it is active. This upgrade increases the duration of the Frost Burn skill by 1, and increases the amount this skill reduces enemies defense by 5%. Each level of this skill costs 2 skill points, and provides 1 point of progress in the skill tree for both of it's elements. The max level of this skill is 2.

Firestorm is the combo effect you get when casting Fire and Lightning together. It deals significant damage to one foe, and has an AOE damage effect that hits all of your foes. This upgrade increases the portion of the damage that hits \fball\fb enemies in this spell, including the original target, by 30%, as well as causing this spell to set all enemies hit on fire, dealing the same damage as the burn spell but only lasting a single turn. This skill costs 2 skill points, and provides 1 point of progress in both of its elements. The max level of this skill is 2.

Firestorm is the combo effect you get when casting Fire and Lightning together. It deals significant damage to one foe, and has an AOE damage effect that hits all of your foes. This upgrade increases the portion of the damage that hits \fball\fb enemies in this spell, including the original target, by 30%, as well as increasing this spells burn duration to 2 turns. This skill costs 2 skill points, and provides 1 point of progress in both of its elements. The max level of this skill is 2.

Hail is a powerful single target spell, which creates a mass of ice to hail down upon a foe. The spell also pulls all of the ice from FrostShield as well, adding more damage to the spell the more stacks of that ability you have active. This spell consumes all stacks of frost shield when cast.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.
Extra Damage per stack of FrostShield: 2 + 20% of your power

Hail is a powerful single target spell, which creates a mass of ice to hail down upon a foe. The spell also pulls all of the ice from FrostShield as well, adding more damage to the spell the more stacks of that ability you have active. This spell consumes all stacks of frost armor when cast.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.
Extra Damage per stack of FrostShield: 2 + 20% of your power

Frozen Fortress is a purely defensive ability, granting significant damage reduction for several turns, alongside a bonus shield equal to 20% of your maximum health which lasts until it is destroyed by enemy attacks, or the fight ends. The skills innate defensive bonus provides a 25% damage reduction for three turns, but also provides the Frost Shield defensive bonus, the duration and damage reduction of which is based upon your current level in the Frost Shield skill.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Frozen Fortress is a purely defensive ability, granting significant damage reduction for several turns, alongside a bonus shield equal to 20% of your maximum health which lasts until it is destroyed by enemy attacks, or the fight ends. The skills innate defensive bonus provides a 25% damage reduction for three turns, but also provides the Frost Shield defensive bonus, the duration and damage reduction of which is based upon your current level in the Frost Shield skill.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Pillar of Flames, a powerful spell which envelops your foe in a pillar of fire, blinding them and setting them ablaze. This will cause your foe to panic, forcing them to use a basic attack and pick a target at random, even harming themselves at times. The burn effect of this spell is the same as the burn from the basic Fire spell.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Pillar of Flames, a powerful spell which envelops your foe in a pillar of fire, blinding them and setting them ablaze. This will cause your foe to panic, forcing them to use a basic attack and pick a target at random, even harming themselves at times. The damage of the burn is based on the current level of your burn skill.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Flame Wave, allowing you to crash a wave of fire into all of your foes, stunning them for a turn and setting them ablaze. The burn effect of this spell is the same as the burn from the basic Fire spell.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Flame Wave, allowing you to crash a wave of fire into all of your foes, stunning them for a turn and setting them ablaze. The burn effect of this spell is the same as the burn from the basic Fire spell.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Barrage, a powerful spell that lets you rain down three successive bolts of lightning onto a single foe. Each bolt of lightning has an innate 60% chance to stun your enemy, but will also separately proc the electric shock skill if you’ve upgraded it, potentially letting you stun an opponent for 6 turns in total.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.
Total Base Damage: 24 + 175% of your power

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Barrage, a powerful spell that lets you rain down three successive bolts of lightning onto a single foe, dealing massive damage and stunning them for two turns. Each bolt of lightning can trigger the Electric Shock skill, potentially stunning your foe for five turns in total.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.
Total Base Damage: 24 + 175% of your power

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Tempest, an unpredictable spell that calls a thunderstorm upon the battlefield, and rains lightning indiscriminately for five turns. Which does mean that it can—and will—hit you at times. Tempest has an equal chance of hitting every target on the field. But it's not all bad, because Tempest will deal reduced damage to you, (you are the one who casted it, after all), and it will also infuse your body with a bit extra magic, boosting your magical power until you cast another spell. These lightning bolts ignore the targets defense entirely, and can stun enemies through the Electric Shock skill, but they won't stun you.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Upgrading this skill grants you access to Tempest, an unpredictable spell that calls a thunderstorm upon the battlefield, and rains lightning indiscriminately for five turns. Which does mean that it can—and will—hit you at times. Tempest has an equal chance of hitting every target on the field. But it's not all bad, because Tempest will deal reduced damage to you, (you are the one who casted it, after all), and it will also infuse your body with a great deal of extra magic, boosting the damage of the next spell you cast. These lightning bolts can stun enemies through the Electric Shock skill, but they won't stun you.
Every time you unlock a new empowered magic spell, you gain another charge of empowered magic, which refill upon a full rest. This skill only has one level, and costs two skill points to unlock.

Focus your Ice spell towards its natural defensive capabilities. When casting Ice, focus on the shield that forms around you instead of the shards of Ice themselves. As a result, while Frost Shield is active, you’ll heal for a small percentage of your maximum hp each turn, but reduce the damage of the basic ice spell as well.
Healing per turn: 2.5% of maximum health.

Focus your Ice spell towards its natural defensive capabilities. When casting Ice, focus on the shield that forms around you instead of the shards of Ice themselves. As a result, while Frost Shield is active, you’ll heal for a small percentage of your maximum hp each turn, but reduce the damage of the basic ice spell as well.
Healing per turn: 2.5% of maximum health.

Turn the Ice spell into a more offensive tool. Causing your icicles to be more brittle and shatter as you fire them, dealing a small amount of extra damage to both your target and all other foes. As a result of your Ice being more fragile, the resulting Frost Shield will be slightly weaker.

Turn the Ice spell into a more offensive tool. Causing your icicles to be more brittle and shatter as you fire them, dealing a small amount of extra damage to both your target and all other foes. As a result of your Ice being more fragile, the resulting Frost Shield will be slightly weaker.

Make the cone of Flames you fire wider, focusing on igniting everything in sight, partially blinding opponents while they remain ablaze. The unfocused strike has a chance to miss its target as a result.

Make the cone of Flames you fire wider, focusing on igniting everything in sight, partially blinding opponents while they remain ablaze. The unfocused strike has a chance to miss its target as a result.

Focus the power behind the burns your spell leaves behind. Adds a 20% chance to detonate all stacks of burn on the target of this spell, dealing the full damage of that burn immediately. Triggers after burn is normally applied, dealing a minimum of 3 stacks of burn damage. The intense heat of your own spell has a 25% chance to Backfire, which will deal extra damage to both you and your target.

Focus the power behind the burns your spell leaves behind. Adds a 20% chance to detonate all stacks of burn on the target of this spell, dealing the full damage of that burn immediately. Triggers after burn is normally applied, dealing a minimum of 3 stacks of burn damage. The intense heat of your own spell has a 25% chance to Backfire, which will deal extra damage to both you and your target.

Give into the wild nature of Lightning, and let its energy burst from you without restraint. Provides a chance for your basic Lightning spell to strike again, potentially multiple times, but with a smaller chance for the spell to instead strike you in addition to your target.

Give into the wild nature of Lightning, and let its energy burst from you without restraint. Provides a chance for your basic Lightning spell to strike again, potentially multiple times, but with a smaller chance for the spell to instead strike yourself.

Bring Lightning more firmly under your power, and retain extra energy after your strike. For one turn after casting Lightning, you will gain extra power, but holding that energy within you will dim your defenses as well.

Bring Lightning more firmly under your power, and retain extra energy after your strike. For one turn after casting Lightning, you will gain extra power, but holding that energy within you will dim your defenses as well.
Increases the effectiveness of healing charges out of combat significantly, from 50% of your maximum health to 75%.
Increases the effectiveness of healing charges out of combat significantly, from 50% of your maximum health to 75%.

Resist the corruption flowing through your soul, reducing your level of depraved weakness by two. If this reduces your level of depraved weakness to a negative value, they will prevent you from gaining future levels for each negative point.

Resist the corruption flowing through your soul, reducing your level of depraved weakness by two. If this reduces your level of depraved weakness to a negative value, they will prevent you from gaining future levels for each negative point.

Empowered Magic: Infuse yourself with holy energy, restoring 10% of your max hp for four turns. Casting this is a free action, if you have multiple actions for any other reason, use this skill first. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills.

Empowered Magic: Restore 10% of your max hp for four turns. Casting this is a free action, if you have multiple actions for any other reason, use this skill first. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills.
The blessing of the Goddess restores you, healing you for 20% of your maximum health after each combat encounter.
The blessing of the Goddess restores you, healing you for 20% of your maximum health after each combat encounter.
The essence of the divine speeds your spells, allowing you to cast three spells in an instant. Casting this is a free action, if you have multiple actions for any other reason, use this skill first.

Repent against your sins, reducing your level of depraved weakness by two. If this reduces your level of depraved weakness to a negative value, they will prevent you from gaining future levels for each negative point.

Repent against your sins, reducing your level of depraved weakness by two. If this reduces your level of depraved weakness to a negative value, they will prevent you from gaining future levels for each negative point.
Let your rage fuel you, making your spells more powerful the closer you are to defeat. Deal up to 30% bonus damage based on missing health, but take 7.5% additional damage from attacks.
Let your rage fuel you, making your spells more powerful the closer you are to defeat. Deal up to 30% bonus damage based on missing health, but take 7.5% additional damage from attacks.

Empowered Magic: Sacrifice 15% of your max health (this can kill you!) to eviscerate one foe, dealing damage equal to 275% of your power + 27. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills. The damage of this skill increases by 4% per depravity level.

Empowered Magic: Sacrifice 15% of your max health (this can kill you!) to eviscerate one foe, dealing damage equal to 275% of your power + 27. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills. The damage of this skill increases by 4% per depravity level.

Gain better control over your depravity, and reduce the negative impact on depraved weakness to provide a 3% increase in damage taken per level, rather than 4%. That would currently reduce bonus damage taken by \v[706]%.

Gain better control over your depravity, and reduce the negative impact on depraved weakness to provide a 3% increase in damage taken per level, rather than 4%. This currently reduces bonus damage taken by \v[706]%.
Refuse to fall to your enemies, gaining up to 20% damage reduction the lower your health is, but take 5% additional damage from attacks at all times.
Refuse to fall to your enemies, gaining up to 20% damage reduction the lower your health is, but take 5% additional damage from attacks at all times.

Empowered magic: Sacrifice 25% of your maximum health to infuse your magic with the ability to leech strength from your foes, healing you for 40% of damage dealt in combat. Lasts until the end of the combat encounter. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills.

Empowered magic: Sacrifice 25% of your maximum health to infuse your magic with the ability to leech strength from your foes, healing you for 40% of damage dealt in combat. Lasts until the end of the combat encounter. Learning this spell does not provide extra max mana like other empowered magic skills.
Channel the dark energy of depravity into strength. Gain 1% bonus damage for each level of depraved weakness you have. Currently, that would be \v[706]%.
Channel the dark energy of depravity into strength. Gain 1% bonus damage for each level of depraved weakness you have. Currently, that is \v[706]%.

As you gain levels of depravity, the depraved energy flowing through you weakens you, sapping your defense. After all, \c[30]giving in feels \fiso\fi good, doesn’t it?\c[0] You take 5% additional damage from all attacks per level of depraved weakness, unless you have any skills that reduce this damage.
\C[25]Reset this skill tree? This has no cost, and only effects skills in this skill tree.
